author: DHowett-MSFT
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$Host.UI.RawUI.BufferSize=$Host.UI.RawUI.WindowSize
Start-Transcript
ipconfig
ipconfig
ipconfig
Stop-Transcript
```

# Expected behavior

The transcript contains all three ipconfig outputs.

# Actual behavior

The transcript contains only the first ipconfig output.

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Terminal user reports in https://github.com/microsoft/terminal/issues/5919 that this applies to 6.x and 5.1 as well.

This also reproduces when the console viewport is at the bottom of the screen:

```powershell
("`n" * $Host.UI.RawUI.BufferSize.Height)
Start-Transcript
ipconfig
ipconfig
ipconfig
Stop-Transcript
```

If the transcript feature relies on the ability to mark and read back buffer contents, this will never work completely correctly!
title: Transcript does not reliably contain native command output when Console BufferSize == Console WindowSize (or when window is at bottom of buffer)
